ygData.subject: Re: Is the verdict finally in?
ygData.msgSnippet: Well I feel if someone can have access to there bank account in the game now that would be a bunch of *hit. I mean come on for some pimple faced moron to sit
ygData.messageBody:
Well I feel if someone can have access to there bank account in the game now
that would be a bunch of *hit.
I mean come on for some pimple faced moron to sit down and try to figure
it out.
I mean only a moron whould even try to do anything like this.


Anyways I hope I did not offend anyone, but this is how I feel about
hackers.

Lancoche(karana)


----- Original Message -----
From: Kenneth Harrison <kharriso@...>
To: <EQCheats@onelist.com>
Sent: Saturday, August 28, 1999 10:23 AM
Subject: RE: [EQCheats] Is the verdict finally in?


> From: Kenneth Harrison <kharriso@...>
>
> not true. I play from 2 different systems and my bank and money stays the
same.
>
> Bantis
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Trevalien Manix [SMTP:trevalien@...]
> Sent: Friday, August 27, 1999 10:28 AM
> To: EQCheats@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [EQCheats] Is the verdict finally in?
>
> From: "Trevalien Manix" <trevalien@...>
>
> I realy hope this is wrong...If a cheat becomes available i will quit EQ.
I
> can imagine me saving up to get my banded cape (the last peice i need for
> full banded i think) and i see a lvl 1 ranger walk past me with Full
Thorny
> Vine Armor, A Darkwood Bow, Fish Bone Earings, and A Pegasus Cloak. (those
> are the items on my wishlist). I would probably chalange him to a dual but
> he might kick my ass in that stuff!
>
> Trevalien
>
>
> >From: "kale usi" <kaleusi@...>
> >Reply-To: EQCheats@onelist.com
> >To: EQCheats@onelist.com
> >Subject: [EQCheats] Is the verdict finally in?
> >Date: Fri, 27 Aug 1999 05:27:50 PDT
> >
> >From: "kale usi" <kaleusi@...>
> >
> >It's been suggested from a knowledgeable hacker, that important
information
> >(such as your characters banking information) is stored locally on your
> >hard
> >drive in a packed file. Has anyone else been able to unpack any files to
> >verify/refute this? If this is found to be true, then it looks as though
EQ
> >has been hacked like UO.
> >
